title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Cannot open file in another editor if already opened in one (no error message)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error message)
OB: When a java file is opened in the workbench and then right-clicked and tried to open with the system editor, nothing happens. There is no warning message or error message displayed.
EB: When a java file is already opened in one editor, and the user tries to open it with another editor, the workbench should display a warning message indicating that the user may overwrite changes and asking if they want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be shown stating that all files should be closed first before opening in another editor. This behavior should be implemented as a safety feature to prevent external editing while the file is already opened in the workbench.
SR:
1. Make sure there is an associated Windows editor for java files. If not, go to the file explorer, double-click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files.
2. Switch to the Java Perspective.
3. Open a java file by double-clicking on it.
4. Right-click on the opened java file.
5. Select 'Open With' and choose 'System Editor'.
6. Notice that nothing happens. The workbench should display a warning message indicating the possibility of overwriting changes or an error message stating that all files should be closed first before opening in another editor.
